intro: Stobaea epitrachys, commonly known as the hairy stobaea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with a distinctive central disk surrounded by ray florets. Stobaea epitrachys is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
